comment.author: 82797434@N02
comment._content: This is an Me P.1101.  One of the first, if not the first, swing wing aircraft built.  The wings were bolted in place and were positioned before flight depending on the mission.  After WWII most of this aircraft was moved to Wright-Patterson AFB Ohio.  In 1947 Bell aircraft took it over and it was renamed the X-5.
